page.title: 17HOWNAM HALL:A SOCIAL CENTRE
page.content: The hall at Hownam,in Scotland,is like many others in the borders;a redundant village school,now put to good use by the local community.It was last used to educate in the 1940's,with rolls up to 20.It lies at the end of the street detached and somewhat forlorn looking, a one roomed building with bare boards and high windows, but what fun goes on within it's walls in the 1980's. It hosts the S.W.R.I. and the indoor bowl -ing club regularly throughout the darker evenings;sees children parties whist drives;domino tournaments,and sales of work spread over the years.It is used for polling at General Elections,and was used as a base for the mountain rescue squad. Apart from a small grant it is entirely funded by local events. Everyone who lives in the area uses it at least once,and many up to 35 times in the year.
